titleStmt.title: Despatch from John H. Smyth to John Hay, April 1, 1880

bibl.title: Despatch from John H. Smyth to John Hay
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p:
Consulate General of the United States,
Monrovia, Liberia, April 1, 1880.
Mr. Jno. H. Smyth to the Ass't Sec'y.
The returns for the Third Quarter 1879, ended March 31, 1880.

Consulate General of the United States,
Monrovia, Liberia, April 1st, 1880.
I have the honor to respectfully transmit you herewith the returns for 3rd quarter 1879, which began January 1st and ended March 31st 1880.

Enclosed please find digest of the invoice book, marked #1; this is a very small return, but this is due to the fact that but little coffee has been sent to the U.S. this year, and also, because the American bark "Monrovia"–now loading, had expected to get off before the close of the quarter carrying (as she will) many thousand pounds of coffee, and much other Liberian produce. The yield of coffee this season is vastly greater than that of any other season. Despatches
Hon. John Hay,
Assistant Secretary of State
Washington, D.C.
Despatches received marked 2, and despatches sent marked 3, are enclosed; also, a list of arrival and departure of American vessels–marked 4; and quarterly statement of fees received on account of vessels–marked 5; transcript of the fee book, containing all the fees received during the quarter marked #6; salary account marked 7; as to this a/c I have failed in drawing drafts to uniformly mark the quarter in which they are drawn on the face of the papers; and an abstract of contingent expenses with vouchers–marked #8.

With considerations of esteem
I am, Sir,
Your obd't serv't
Jno. H. Smyth,
U.S. Consul General.

1 Digest of Invoice book
2 Despatches received
3 Despatches sent
4 Arrivals & Departures of American vessels
5 Quarterly Statement of fees rec'd on account of vessels
6 Transcript of fee book
7 Salary account
8 Contingent expenses
